casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Mark Wayne JOHNSON, Defendant-Appellant. No. 07-40842

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Aug. 20, 2008. James Lee Turner, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Southern Dis*812trict of Texas, Houston, TX, for PlaintiffAppellee. Mark Wayne Johnson, Beaumont, TX, pro se. John Grant Jones, Corpus Christi, TX, for Defendant-Appellant.

Before GARZA, CLEMENT, and SOUTHWICK, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Mark Wayne Johnson has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Johnson has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no nonfrivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
